intro: Purpurella muricata, commonly known as the purple-fruited rock apple, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and clustered, small leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. Its fruit, which is typically purple or red when mature, is edible and has a tart, acidic flavor. The species is often found growing in rocky or coastal areas, adapting well to poor soil conditions.
